skill.name: conventions
skill.description: Load coding conventions and style guidelines when writing or reviewing code. Ensures consistency with project standards.
skill.summary: Load coding conventions and style guidelines when writing or reviewing code. Ensures consistency wit...
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based knowledge skill that only defines metadata for loading coding conventions. No executable code, no network access, no file system access beyond reading convention files, and no external commands.

content.value_statement: Teams need consistent coding standards to maintain code quality. This skill loads project conventions to ensure code follows established patterns.
actual_capabilities: Loads project coding conventions from memory
limitations: Requires manual activation by the user

use_cases.title: Write new code
use_cases.description: Write new code that follows project conventions and standards

use_cases.title: Review code
use_cases.description: Review code for convention compliance during pull requests

use_cases.title: Refactor code
use_cases.description: Ensure refactored code matches project conventions

prompt_templates.title: Load project conventions
prompt_templates.scenario: Getting started with a new project

prompt_templates.title: Review code standards
prompt_templates.scenario: Checking if code meets project conventions
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for convention compliance

prompt_templates.title: Ask about conventions
prompt_templates.prompt: What does our convention say about naming async functions?

prompt_templates.title: Generate with conventions
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a new module following standards
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a new service file following our conventions

output_examples.input: What are our naming conventions for constants?
output: Group related constants in a single object export

best_practices: Load conventions before starting new files or modules
Update conventions when project standards change
anti_patterns: Writing code without checking conventions first
Skipping convention checks during pull requests

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code, Claude, and Codex. Check individual tool documentation for compatibility.

faq.question: What conventions are included?
faq.answer: Naming, file organization, error handling, testing, and documentation conventions are supported.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my project?
faq.answer: Add conventions.json to memory/knowledge/codebase/ directory with your project standards.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only reads convention files. No data is transmitted or stored externally.

faq.question: Why are my conventions not loading?
faq.answer: Ensure conventions.json exists at the correct path and is valid JSON format.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Conventions provide guidelines for code structure while linters enforce syntax rules automatically.
